My Experience and Skills

Education

George Mason University
August 2019 - May 2021
M.A. Data Analytics

Grove City College
August 2016 - May 2016
B.A. Economics

Experience

Software Developer – Mercatus Center at George Mason University
February 2019 - present
  • Aiding in the development and improvement of the open-sourced QuantGov policy analytics platform, which uses text analysis and machine learning to create datasets from text. Updating the RegData project, which uses the QuantGov platform to analyze the Code of Federal Regulations and estimate the extent to which U.S. industries are regulated.
  • Producing datasets for the State RegData project, which involves web scraping regulatory codes from state government websites, converting the documents to text, and using the QuantGov platform to analyze the text.
  • Building various data and software products using a variety of different tools including Python, AWS products, SQL, and Docker.

Data Analyst – Political Non-Profit
June 2018 - February 2019
  • Collected election and candidate data for use in political science research, primarily using Python to web scrape the data.
  • Data cleaning, management, and validation using Python, SQL, and the Azure data management suite.

Program Coordinator and Python Developer – Mercatus Center
August 2016 - June 2018
  • Various research assistance tasks, including gathering data for quantitative projects, producing literature reviews, and drafting charts.
  • Coauthored and managed the production of the quarterly Economic Situation Report by economist Bruce Yandle, which involves drafting charts and original research on the economic and regulatory situation of various states.

Programming Skills

  • Python
    • Data wrangling and cleaning using pandas.
    • Producing data visualizations using matplotlib and seaborn.
    • Statistical modeling and machine learning using scikit-learn and statsmodels.
    • Web scraping using requests, Beautiful Soup, and Selenium.
    • Predicting and discovering patterns in text using regular expressions.
    • Building software infrastructure compliant with Pep8 style guide and coding standards.

  • Amazon Web Services
    • Data management with RDS and S3.
    • Building and running cloud-based software on EC2, Batch, and Lambda.
    • Managing and monitoring products using Cloudwatch and Cloudfront.

  • Building reproducible software products using Docker.

  • Developing and delivering software and data products through the Scrum agile methodology.

  • Maintaining code quality and version control using the GitHub platform.

  • Data wrangling, cleaning, and management using SQL and R.
